text: :footprints:coffee supply is super low
<@U02F8LF2X>: can we get a cheapo scale and have it talk to a R. Pi to alert us when coffee is running low?
we could I suppose. would need three load cells. seems like we could just order based on stock observation and historical trends but maybe I'm missing something
You and your common sense.
isn't the coffee maker already smart enough to know when it's brewing coffee and how much?
>order based on stock observation and historical trends
:+1: :chewbacca:

Sorry <@U026PT0D7>, what I meant is placing the tub with the beans on top of the scale and have it tells when we’re running low.

I know, I know, we could do that by ourselves without a scale but it seems to me that hasn’t worked so far and we only hear about it when we are dangerously close to null coffee.
Can't we infer bean usage by how many cups we're brewing?
I don't really know how coffee works, so disregard if I'm being silly
I think it varies depending on busy days, guests we or Uber invite to the office, etc. But, I have the math skills of an Austrian donkey so I wouldn’t know how to gather those trends.
<!channel>: we on average go through about 5lbs of coffee per week. We are on a recurring schedule of 20# being delivered on the 2nd monday of every month.
Someone needs to tell me when we have run out of the last bag of coffee - I usually have some stashed away.
we will have a delivery this coming Monday.
are we so low that we cannot get thru Monday?
it looks really low. I think we’ll run out before the end of the day.
<http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-tMTEQemgh0Y/U6rg00Jo1FI/AAAAAAAADFI/_2WJd8Nt3b4/s1600/waterave.png>
They miss all of you
Actually I don't recognize many of them anymore...
yeah its just a bunch of strangers there now
and Emily
And Emily, yes
Emily's the best anyway
She is the coolest barista. I am glad she is my barista
re: the "no bottle caps" note on the recycling <http://www.enviromom.com/2010/01/portland-how-to-properly-recycle-small-scrap-metal-curbside.html>

attachments.text: **** We try really hard not to overwhelm you guys with nit-picky stuff. This post is kind of nit-picky. But we also know that we have some hard-core recyclers from Portland checking in here, so this one goes out to...
attachments.fallback: **** We try really hard not to overwhelm you guys with nit-picky stuff. This post is kind of nit-picky. But we also know that we have some hard-core recyclers from Portland checking in here, so this one goes out to...

text: (it was news to me, so I looked it up. TIL!)
oh interesting. I had assumed the no bottle caps note was referring to plastic bottle lids/caps since we have vitamin water bottles now
the point about not putting aluminum caps in steel cans (or vise versa) seems kinda nitpicky, but makes sense.
Maybe we could build a cap-receptacle that would sort out the magnetic ones from the nonmagnetic ones.
purchased some new chargers for the conf room booking systems.
will install them on mountain and courtyard when they arrive. current issue is that they're both being drained of juice
